name: vega-lite
author: Jeffrey Heer, Dominik Moritz, Kanit "Ham" Wongsuphasawat
description: Vega-lite provides a higher-level grammar for visual analysis, comparable to ggplot or Tableau, that generates complete Vega specifications.

scripts.build: browserify src/vl.ts -p tsify -d -s vl | exorcist vega-lite.js.map > vega-lite.js
scripts.postbuild: uglifyjs vega-lite.js -cm --in-source-map vega-lite.js.map --source-map vega-lite.min.js.map > vega-lite.min.js && npm run schema
scripts.build:all: npm run clean && npm run build && npm run test:noschema && npm run build:images
scripts.clean: rm -f vega-lite.* & find -E src test site -regex '.*\.(js|js.map|d.ts)' -delete & rm -rf examples/_diff examples/_original examples/_output examples/images && rm -rf data
scripts.schema: typescript-json-schema --required true --noExtraProps true src/spec.ts ExtendedSpec > vega-lite-schema.json
scripts.presite: tsc && npm run build && bower install && npm run data && npm run build:toc
scripts.posttest: npm run lint && npm run test:examples
scripts.test:noschema: npm run pretest && nyc --reporter=html --reporter=text-summary mocha && npm run lint && mocha examples
scripts.test:debug: npm run schema && mocha --debug-brk test examples
scripts.watch:build: watchify src/vl.ts -p tsify -v -d -s vl -o 'exorcist vega-lite.js.map > vega-lite.js'
scripts.watch: nodemon -x 'npm run build && npm run test:noschema' # already run schema in build
